pull.title: scripted-diff: Fix includes when secp256k1 is locally installed on macOS
pull.body:
If `secp256k1` is [locally installed](https://github.com/bitcoin-core/secp256k1/blob/master/README.md#build-steps) on macOS, during Bitcoin Core building a compiler looks for `/usr/local/include/secp256k1.h` instead of `secp256k1.h` in the source tree (#20351).

Fix #20351.

verification.payload:
tree 84fccc236a9511c961356faeb8dd6c9394a45e32
parent 42f950cb27b732782d55282cdcd934396fcd7071
author Hennadii Stepanov <32963518+hebasto@users.noreply.github.com> 1605079077 +0200
committer Hennadii Stepanov <32963518+hebasto@users.noreply.github.com> 1605079682 +0200

scripted-diff: Fix includes when secp256k1 is locally installed on macOS

-BEGIN VERIFY SCRIPT-
sed -i 's|#include <secp256k1|#include <secp256k1/include/secp256k1|' src/key.cpp src/pubkey.cpp src/test/fuzz/secp256k1*
sed -i '/BITCOIN_INCLUDES += -I$(srcdir)\/secp256k1\/include/d' src/Makefile.am
-END VERIFY SCRIPT-

events.message:
scripted-diff: Fix includes when secp256k1 is locally installed on macOS

-BEGIN VERIFY SCRIPT-
sed -i 's|#include <secp256k1|#include <secp256k1/include/secp256k1|' src/key.cpp src/pubkey.cpp src/test/fuzz/secp256k1*
sed -i '/BITCOIN_INCLUDES += -I$(srcdir)\/secp256k1\/include/d' src/Makefile.am
-END VERIFY SCRIPT-

Concept NACK. This is the wrong way to fix this.

After upgrading Big Sur 11.0.1 from Beta 20B28 to 20B29, I'm not able to reproduce the initial buggy behavior. Also I cannot reproduce it on Catalina 10.15.7 (19H15).

Closing.
